head.title: KOREAN BANK WORKERS PREPARE TO STRIKE

hedline.hl1: KOREAN BANK WORKERS PREPARE TO STRIKE

abstract.p: South Koreans are bracing for impending financial chaos next week as tens of thousands of unionized bank workers support nationwide strike set for July 11; workers are protesting government plans to restructure industry, which calls for consolidation of number of banks; union workers contend plans would lead to major layoffs (S)

block.p: South Koreans braced for impending financial chaos next week as tens of thousands of bank workers supported a nationwide strike set for July 11, according to preliminary results of a vote by some 50,000 industry workers. Around 90 percent of unionized bank workers at 24 financial institutions, including 8 of the nation's 10 major commercial banks, voted in favor of a nationwide strike to protest government plans to restructure the industry, which call for the consolidation of a number of banks. Union workers contended the plans would lead to major layoffs. The final results of the vote, which began on Monday, are expected early today.
